page.title: 13OLD BUILDINGS IN CAISTOR
page.content: Notable buildings in Caistor include: {The parish church of St.Peter & {St.Paul,}which dates back to Saxon times although most of the present building is Norman. { The Roman Wall,}part of which can be seen in the Grammar School grounds and to the south of the parish church. {The Grammar School old hall}dated 1631 {Congregational Chapel,dated 1842 which is now the Grammar School library. {The Methodist Church}dated 1867. {The Church}on PloughHill which is now the Youth Club {The Town Hall,dated 1887,built to mark the 50th.anniversary of the reign of Queen Victoria,and used as a public hall for dances,films, concerts and public meetings. {The Arts Centre,}used for exhibitions dances and children's playgroup.
